member.summary: The name of the value indicating the maximum number of most-recently-used(MRU) items to show in the drop-down list of the Visual Studio common search control. Name is “MaximumMRUItems”.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.RestartSearchIfUnchanged
member.summary: The name of the flag indicating whether searches will be restarted, even if the search string is not changed, by pressing Enter or selecting a most-recently-used (MRU) item from the list. Name is “RestartSearchIfUnchanged”.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.SearchButtonVisible
member.summary: The name of the flag indicating whether the search button is visible in the Visual Studio common search control. Name is “SearchButtonVisible”.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.SearchClearTooltip
member.summary: The name of the value indicating the search button tooltip to display after a search is complete. Name is “SearchClearTooltip”.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.SearchPopupAutoDropdown
member.summary: The name of the flag indicating whether the search popup is automatically shown when the user begins typing. This is only relevant for delayed and on-demand searches in the Visual Studio common search control. Name is “SearchPopupAutoDropdown".

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.SearchPopupCloseDelay
member.summary: The name of the value indicating the delay, in milliseconds, after a search is automatically started in the search control, until the search popup is automatically closed. Name is “SearchPopupCloseDelay”.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.SearchProgressShowDelay
member.summary: The name of the value indicating the delay, in milliseconds, after a search is started in the search control, until the progress indicator automatically displays. Name is “SearchProgressShowDelay”.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.SearchProgressType
member.summary: The name of the value indicating the progress type supported by the Visual Studio common search control. Name is “SearchProgressType”.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.SearchStartDelay
member.summary: The name of the value indicating the delay, in milliseconds, until a delayed search starts automatically in the Visual Studio common search control. Name is “SearchStartDelay”.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.SearchStartMinChars
member.summary: The name of the value indicating the minimum number of characters for relevance in a search. The Visual Studio common search control will wait to start a new search until the user types at least the minimum number of characters. Name is “SearchStartMinChars”.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.SearchStartTooltip
member.summary: The name of the value indicating the search button tooltip to display before the Visual Studio common search control starts a search. Name is “SearchStartTooltip”.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.SearchStartType
member.summary: The name of the value indicating the search start type of the Visual Studio common search control. Name is “SearchStartType”.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.SearchStopTooltip
member.summary: The name of the value indicating the search button tooltip to display during a search by the Visual Studio common search control. Name is “SearchStopTooltip”.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.SearchTooltip
member.summary: The name of the value indicating the tooltip for the search box of the Visual Studio common search control. Name is “SearchTooltip”.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.SearchTrimsWhitespaces
member.summary: The name of the flag indicating whether the Visual Studio common search control trims whitespace from the beginning and end of the search string before starting a search or adding the item to the most-recently-used (MRU) list. Name is “SearchTrimsWhitespaces”

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.SearchUseMRU
member.summary: The name of a flag indicating whether the Visual Studio common search control displays most-recently-used (MRU) items in the drop-down list. Name is “SearchUseMRU”.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.PlatformUI.SearchSettingsDataSource.PropertyNames.SearchWatermark
member.summary: The name of the value indicating the string to display in the Visual Studio common search control when it is empty and does not have the focus. Value is “SearchWatermark”.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.ActiveSolutionLoadManager
member.summary: Gets or sets a pointer to the active Solution Load Manager. The default is a null reference. A solution load manager is able to control how projects are loaded during the Solution Open operation. It can control whether projects are loaded immediately, loaded in the background (at idle), left to be loaded if needed, or set to stay unloaded. A solution load manager is expected to implement . A common approach is to have the solution load manager package autoload for the SolutionOpening UIContext, for example, [ProvideAutoLoad(UIContextGuids.SolutionOpening)]. This property can also be set during or during for the pre solution section.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.AddNewProjectAsSibling
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean: true if new projects should be added on the sibling directory of the solution, otherwise false.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.BaseSolutionExplorerCaption
member.summary: Gets or sets the base caption for the Solution Explorer tool window. The default is "SolutionExplorer". The full caption is built by concatenating BaseSolutionExplorerCaption and .

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.CountOfProjectsBeingLoaded
member.summary: The count of projects in file being opened (valid only during open).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.DeferredSaveSolution
member.summary: Indicates if the solution is "zero-impact" (that is, a permanent save is performed explicitly using File.SaveAll). If true, the solution is zero-impact.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.FaultedProjectCount
member.summary: The number of faulted projects in the solution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.FileDefaultCodePage
member.summary: The code page for saving files (CP_ACP/CP_WINUNICODE).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.IsAProjectClosing
member.summary: The IUnknown of of the project being closed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.IsInBackgroundIdleLoadProjectBatch
member.summary: Returns true if Visual Studio is currently loading a batch of pending projects triggered in the background at idle. IVsSolutionLoadEvents::OnBeforeLoadProjectBatch(true) has been called.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.IsInSyncDemandLoadProjectBatch
member.summary: Returns true if Visual Studio is currently loading a batch of pending projects synchronously triggered by some user action or command invocation that requires a set of projects to be loaded. IVsSolutionLoadEvents::OnBeforeLoadProjectBatch(false) has been called.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.IsOpenNotificationPending
member.summary: Indicates if the notification is pending. If true, the notification is pending. This occurs when a new project is being created with a new solution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.IsSavingOnClose
member.summary: Indicates if the solution is being saved when closing. If true, the solution is being saved when closing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.IsSolutionClosing
member.summary: Indicates if a solution file is being closed. If true, the solution file is being closed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.IsSolutionDirty
member.summary: Indicates if the solution is dirty. If true, the solution file is dirty.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.IsSolutionFullyLoaded
member.summary: Indicates if all projects have been loaded by the Background Solution Load feature. If true, all projects have been loaded in the background.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.IsSolutionNodeHidden
member.summary: Indicates if the solution node is hidden in the integrated development environment (IDE). If true, the solution node is hidden in the IDE.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.IsSolutionOpen
member.summary: Indicates if a solution file is open. If true, the solution file is open.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.IsSolutionOpening
member.summary: Indicates if a solution file is being opened. If true, the solution file is being opened.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.IsSolutionOpeningDocs
member.summary: Indicates if the solution is reopening the documents that were open when the solution was last closed. If true, the solution is reopening the documents.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.IsSolutionSaveAsRequired
member.summary: Indicates if saving the solution requires a Save As dialog. If true, saving the solution does require a Save As dialog.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsSolutionPropID.NewProjectDlgPreferredLanguage
member.summary: The preferred language for the New Project dialog; if there is no preferred language, an empty length string is returned. If there is a preferred language, then the non-preferred language project types are displayed under an "Other Languages" node in the New Project dialog. The preferred language is set by the user's choice of development settings in the Import and Export Settings dialog.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskBodyCallback
member.summary: Used by the asynchronous task library helper as the method type for a task body (what the task executes). Users of the library can either pass in this delegate type directly or use one of the wrapper methods that wraps simpler anonymous functions to this delegate type.
member.param: The task that is executing, that is, the asynchronous task to which the task body belongs. This can be used to check if task cancellation was requested.

An array that contains the dependent tasks that had to be completed before your task. Normally this is either empty if the task was a new task, or it contains a single task if the task was a continuation of another task.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskCreationOptions
member.summary: Specifies the options for creating a task.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskCreationOptions.AttachedToParent
member.summary: Creates the task as attached to the currently-running task. The parent task is not marked as completed until this child task is completed as well.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskCreationOptions.DenyChildAttach
member.summary: A child task cannot be attached to the task.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskCreationOptions.LongRunning
member.summary: The task will be a long-running, coarse-grained operation. It provides a hint to the that oversubscription may be warranted. For background tasks, this member causes the task to run its own thread instead of the thread pool.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskCreationOptions.None
member.summary: The default behavior should be used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskCreationOptions.NotCancelable
member.summary: The task cannot be canceled. Users will get an exception if they try to cancel the task.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.VsTaskCreationOptions.PreferFairness
member.summary: A hint to a to schedule a task in as fair a manner as possible, meaning that tasks scheduled sooner will be more likely to be run sooner, and tasks scheduled later will be more likely to be run later.

[in] Pointer to the IUnknown interface of the newly created object. A value of null indicates that the object is not being created as part of an aggregate. If non-null, this is a pointer to the aggregate object's IUnknown.
[in] Interface to be used to communicate with the object. For example, IID_IClassFactory.
[in] Flags controlling the instance creation from the enumeration. Specifies a value of .
[out] Address of pointer variable that receives the interface pointer requested in . Upon successful return, contains the requested interface pointer. Upon failure, contains null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS
member.summary: Specifies the task’s continuation options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_AttachedToParent
member.summary: The task is attached to a parent in the task hierarchy. The parent task is not marked as completed until this child task is completed as well.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_Default
member.summary: The same as VSTCO_NotOnFaulted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_DenyChildAttach
member.summary: An is thrown if an attempt is made to attach a child task to the created task.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_ExecuteSynchronously
member.summary: The continuation task should be executed synchronously. With this option specified, the continuation is run on the same thread that causes the antecedent task to transition into its final state. If the antecedent is already complete when the continuation is created, the continuation is run on the thread creating the continuation. Only very short-running continuations should be executed synchronously.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_IndependentlyCanceled
member.summary: The task can be canceled independently of any other task.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_LazyCancelation
member.summary: In the case of continuation cancellation, prevents completion of the continuation until the antecedent has completed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_LongRunning
member.summary: The task is a long-running, course-grained operation. It provides a hint to the that oversubscription may be warranted.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_None
member.summary: Default = "Continue on any, no task options, run asynchronously" Specifies that the default behavior should be used. Continuations, by default, are scheduled when the antecedent task completes, regardless of the task's final .

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_NotCancelable
member.summary: The continuation task cannot be canceled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_NotOnCanceled
member.summary: The continuation task should not be scheduled if its antecedent was canceled. This option is not valid for multi-task continuations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_NotOnFaulted
member.summary: The continuation task should not be scheduled if its antecedent threw an unhandled exception. This option is not valid for multi-task continuations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_NotOnRanToCompletion
member.summary: The continuation task should not be scheduled if its antecedent ran to completion. This option is not valid for multi-task continuations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_OnlyOnCanceled
member.summary: The continuation task should be scheduled only if its antecedent was canceled. This option is not valid for multi-task continuations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_OnlyOnFaulted
member.summary: The continuation task should be scheduled only if its antecedent threw an unhandled exception. This option is not valid for multi-task continuations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_OnlyOnRanToCompletion
member.summary: The continuation task should be scheduled only if its antecedent ran to completion. This option is not valid for multi-task continuations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKCONTINUATIONOPTIONS.VSTCO_PreferFairness
member.summary: A hint to a to schedule a task in as fair a manner as possible, meaning that tasks scheduled sooner are more likely to be run sooner, and tasks scheduled later are more likely to be run later.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKWAITOPTIONS
member.summary: Specifies the options for task wait operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKWAITOPTIONS.VSTWO_AbortOnTaskCancellation
member.summary: The task must return from a wait immediately if the task is canceled.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSTASKWAITOPTIONS.VSTWO_None
member.summary: The default behavior should be used.
